Articles.Content:
Which planet/moon do you think is the least visited in the community? I personally think that it's Dres.

I did not include: Kerbin (for an obvious reason), Mun, Minmus, Duna, Jool, and Laythe, since they seem to be very popular, and that the poll limit is 10.

NOTE: I think that Dres may become more popular if/when Squad implements an asteroid field. There would be some very pretty and nice views from Dres with a ton of asteroids floating about.

Edited January 7, 2014 by turkwinif
Yeah the pole setup is weird. I think its dres because that is the one planet I have never visited. I have no point. I mean, its like an atmosphere-less kerbin with no easter eggs.
I've seldom seen landing missions and returns to Moho or Dres. Eeloo is surprisingly popular.
Dres has gravity around the same as Ike and the canyon is a sight to see.

Been to Dres once (with an unmanned probe too). Nothing to see there, just did a mission for science. This small horrible spit of rock... I only hope it will become a part of an asteroid belt in future versions.
Heh, Dres was the first planet I visited with a manned craft outside the Kerbin system.

Been to Dres once (with an unmanned probe too). Nothing to see there, just did a mission for science. This small horrible spit of rock... I only hope it will become a part of an asteroid belt in future versions.

Poor Dres... the canyon is pretty cool. I like the fact there are a few bodies of similar appearance

I voted dres.

I mean, give it something different (not just a canyon) like 3 large moons, or a thin atmosphere, rapid rotation rate, a different colour would do, think about a royal blue dres. I'd go there

By visited, do you mean landed on, orbit, or merely a flyby?

If landed on, I would say Tylo. (Dat Gravity)

If any or all of the above, I would agree with the OP and say Dres.

People see Eeloo as a challenge so that's visited by many people. Dres is like a Junior challenge to Eeloo.

By visited, do you mean landed on, orbit, or merely a flyby?

If landed on, I would say Tylo. (Dat Gravity)

If any or all of the above, I would agree with the OP and say Dres.

People see Eeloo as a challenge so that's visited by many people. Dres is like a Junior challenge to Eeloo.

By visit I mean intentionally entering the planet/moon 's SOI.

The only Jool moon I've been to recently is Laythe and that was a simple flyby because it only cost me 10m/s to divert to go through it's SOI. I haven't landed on any of them.

Nor have I landed on Moho. Everything else I've been to at least once, in some version or another.
Dres is a sad and lonely space potato.

Dress has quite a cool landscape, I visited a few times.

I guess Tylo. Jool has a lot of other cool moons to visit, and landing and getting off again is quite difficult.

Maybe Moho too. It is the hardest planet. But it is still a planet.

Vall's the only body I haven't visited, mainly because I haven't seen a compelling reason to go there. There aren't really any easter eggs (in response to those of you who say Moho, I quite enjoy trying to land at the bottom of the Mohole), and it's not that much of a challenge compared to something like Tylo or Dres.

Edited January 7, 2014 by jjwb22101

Vall's the only body I haven't visited, mainly because I haven't seen a compelling reason to go there. There aren't really any easter eggs (in response to those of you who say Moho, I quite enjoy trying to land at the bottom of the Mohole), and it's not that much of a challenge compared to something like Tylo or Dres.

Oh, there's an easter egg on Vall alright...you just haven't looked hard enough. Believe me, there's one, and it's pretty cool.
I put Gilly simply because it's the only body I've never visited for some reason, even though Eve was the first planet I ever visited.

Dres is a sad and lonely space potato.

Quoted for eternity.
I vote for Dres too. Just easy to forget about it hiding there between Jool and Duna.
I'm going to vote for Moho as I think people may find it harder to get into orbit around.
Apart from the planets you mention and their moons I've only ever visited Eve and its moon

I put Gilly simply because it's the only body I've never visited for some reason, even though Eve was the first planet I ever visited.

Gilly is now an important source of cheap science points in the career mode. You can aerobrake directly into Gilly transfer orbit and effortlessly land there with the whole interplanetary stage without the need of any specialized lander, lift off, and go for second aerobrake to low eve orbit. hundreds of cheap science points at additional 500 or so dV cost.
Voted for bop. never been there. Been to dres once, and forgot putting electricity sources on the rover.
Moho, even with mechjeb the burns to the inner plans drive me nuts lol. As Jeb said, you should be able to just point at the big round bright thing and wind up near it lol
I really haven't been to Eeloo. I haven't sent anything to its SOI, whereas all of the other planets I have. Don't worry Eeloo, I'll visit you some day!
I'd guess it's Dres. It's hard to get to, but not the hardest, and it's far away, but not the farthest. It just doesn't have all that much that would tempt people to try and go there.
